title: To the Lighthouse - Mrs. Ramsay's conjectures

content.question: In the eighteenth sentence of paragraph 3, Mrs. Ramsay’s conjectures about going to the circus and going to a play by Ibsen serve to indicate her

choices.label: view of the decline in popular taste
impatience with Charles Tansley’s tolerance of avant-garde art
recognition of Charles Tansley’s need to be seen as a cultured person

content.answer: recognition of Charles Tansley’s need to be seen as a cultured person

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify and describe what specific textual details reveal about a character, that character's perspective, and that character's motives.
